attributes.action: Give all parents adequate support following the sudden death of a child.
attributes.background: Research has found families in Leeds have insufficient support following the sudden death of a child. The bereavement support study, commissioned by Leeds charity Elliot’s Footprint, identified that the current level of support is ineffective, leaving bereaved parents struggling and grieving alone.
attributes.additional_details:
•	Only 16% of professionals in Leeds think that child bereavement support is currently effective
•	100% of the families who had contacted the counselling service found it unsuitable due to long waiting times or lack of child bereavement experience
•	Over 50% of professionals said they did not know who coordinated child bereavement services in Leeds and 45% saw the need for a single organisation to coordinate it

attributes.action: For the term 'Accountant' to be legally defined and protected.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to have the term ‘accountant’ legally defined and protected.
attributes.additional_details: This is due to us being increasingly concerned by the poor advice businesses and individuals are being given by individuals claiming to be qualified accountants, when in fact they have had little or no professional training and lack the qualifications to deal with complex financial issues.

attributes.action: Ban ALL antifreeze preparations unless they contain a bitterant
attributes.background: Antifreeze products like screen wash contain Ethylene Glycol that is highly toxic and kills 1000's of pets each year.  A teaspoon is enough to kill a cat, a tablespoon a dog.  Adding a bittering agent to ALL products would take away the sweet taste and discourage animals from licking any spills.

attributes.action: Change or ease the rules surrounding 'gardens' on baby graves.
attributes.background: 8 weeks after burying my little boy, who was born asleep in June of this year, we recieved a "rule book" stating what we can and cannot do with his resting place that a paid for. Such rules included not being able to lay stones and not coming away from the headstone by more then 12" etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I know that the rules in baby gardens and what is 'allowed' differs nationally. After being asked recently to remove ALL items from my little boy's grave, I'm petitioning to get the rules at certain cemeteries eased or changed, to allow bereaved parents to decorate their child's resting place as they see fit, providing it remains maintained by the grave 'owner'. 

Buried babies may only be a plot number to some, but they are our children and deserve their own little gardens. 

Thank you.

attributes.action: Provide protection for closed railway track-beds to aid rural regeneration.
attributes.background: In the mid -1960's Dr Beeching was employed to find ways of making the railways more profitable and his report resulted in the closure of a large part of our railway network. The report failed to take into account the growth in population and the necessity for rural transport.
attributes.additional_details: The railways were mainly built under Act of Parliament. After closure Local Authorities have sold off railway land for development. Usage for footpaths and cycleways is fine. Building houses and industrial estates prevent regeneration of these railways. Scotrail have reopened part of the old Waverley route. Groups would like to reopen lines such as the Somerset, Dorset, Deeside line, Lynton & Barnstable and Matlock, Bakewell & Buxton and Cliffe Hill Mineral Railway. Local authorites should be required to aid projects and reject planning for developments.

attributes.action: Implement the 10 recommendations of the APPG Inquiry Into Quality of New Homes.
attributes.background: The poor quality of new homes is not new. (NHBC, Barker Review of 2004, Office of Fair Trading Market Study of Home Building in the UK October 2008, and more recently the APPG Inquiry 2016) Yet surprisingly, there has not been any legislation to force this industry to improve.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 93% of new home buyers (at least 100,000 a year) report problems to their housebuilder. Defects that could and should have been prevented. The APPG Report is quite clear, the industry needs to be forced to improve both the quality of new homes and the indifferent service suffered by those buying new homes.

As a minimum, the government must implement the APPG Inquiry's “Key Recommendation” - the setting up of a New Homes Ombudsman by the DCLG within 3 months.

attributes.action: Osseointegration for NHS patients
attributes.background: Osseointegration is for a metal implant anchored in to the bone to all prosthetic limbs to be surgically attached. This will vastly improve people's lives. Current the U.K. Government will not fund this. This has to change
attributes.additional_details: Dr kang at the royal free hospital advised me the only way the operations would go ahead is by people pressuring government to allow funding for these operations. Join me in making this a reality and improving so many people's lives

attributes.action: Legalise conjugal visits in UK prisons.
attributes.background: This aims to prompt the introduction of conjugal visits for the 85,998 prisoners in HMPs across the UK. Some will be of the view that prisoners should be granted no privileges, but neglect thought of the spouses who endure great heartache, stress and aloneness whilst their partner is incarcerated.
attributes.additional_details:
Science demonstrates the positive effects that would be seen with regards to reduction of violence and aggrevated incidents within then prison. This is highlighted in hundreds of psychological and scientific case studies.

Not only is a prisoner's own life severely impacted but also their spouses', who have to hold everything together in their partners absence. Spouses did not commit a crime yet bare huge burdens, without the ability to maintain a physical connection with their partner.

attributes.action: Melton Mowbray needs a bypass before 4000 homes are built.
attributes.background: Due to the increased congestion in Melton Mowbray, no more houses should be built until Government funding has been secured and a bypass completed.
attributes.additional_details: a Melton bypass is desperately needed.  Sections of a proposed "Distributor Road" will be built by developers but the important section that links the roads together needs Central Government funding.  Without that link they are roads to nowhere.

attributes.action: Allow motorcyclists aged 19+ to ride a 250cc on a CBT license
attributes.background: You are allowed to ride bikes of up to 55hp when you are 19 on a full bike license and you are allowed to do this with no previous experience. I don't see why riders with 2 years experience shouldn't be able to get a bit of extra power as having a small amount of power can be dangerous at times.

attributes.action: Revisit case law that states Zimbabwe is a safe destination.
attributes.background: The country guidance for Zimbabwe last updated in 2013 currently being used by Home Office to determine asylum cases is outdated. The case law that states that Zimbabwe is a safe destination for failed asylum seekers needs to be revisited as recent atrocities tell  a different story.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some of the links that show the real & current situation in Zimbabwe:
 http://zimbabwerise.com/full-list-of-mugabes-terror-attacks-across-zimbabwe
http://nehandaradio.com/2016/09/21/shocking-pictures-showing-police-brutality-zimbabwe/
http://www.hrforumzim.org/category/reports-on-political-violence/
http://nehandaradio.com/tag/political-violence-in-zimbabwe/
https://www.hrw.org/world-report/2016/country-chapters/zimbabwe

attributes.action: To stop the proposed closure of our local post office in Ulverston Cumbria.
attributes.background:
It's listed as one of the proposed closures...Ulverston is a market town and the post office is an essential part of our community.  It provides essential services including banking with lots of them shutting too.
It's centrally located..a central hub and provides employment and we need to keep it.

attributes.action: Set statutory requirements and laws for rehoming centres to follow in our land
attributes.background: My niece wanted to rehome a dog.She contacted a local rehoming centre.The centre contacted her regarding a dog they thought would suit. On 5th November 2013 the dog turned and savaged to death our Lexi. Inquest revielled alot of things.Let's hope Lexi's Law stops families going through same pain.
attributes.additional_details: Mr Kirkland was surprised no national Standards for which any policy for rehoming should be considered  & no statutory requirements for kennels to make home visits once an animal has been placed in what is believed to be a suitable home.

attributes.action: Abolish unisex toilets in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: In my child's school the toilets have become unisex. The school gave parents and children no notice prior to this happening. My child was shocked when a boy walked into the toilet. The girls in the school do not like it and some boys and girls have stopped using the toilet. This is a health concern.
attributes.additional_details:
These toilets are not like the ones we have at home with the sink, bin toilet in one room behind a closed door. There is a gap at the bottom and the top, there is no privacy. 

Both genders will be going through hormonal & bodily changes. Some girls start their menstrual cycle early. Will they not be embarrassed to use a shared toilet 

Both girls & boys have the right to explore their bodies in their own privacy amongst the same gender. The unisex toilets restrict this development which is sad.

attributes.action: A second EU referendum for all including UK citizens living anywhere in the EU.
attributes.background: I along with about 4 million other UK citizens living in the EU outside the UK and the people of the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man were not consulted in the recent In/Out EU referendum. Also many lies were told by the "Brexit" camp. I understand that Oxford's word of the year is "post-truth".
attributes.additional_details:
I came to work and live in Denmark, thanks to our two countries long association and their being in the EEC (later EU) together.

The recent UK referendum on EU membership did not allow the UK citizens in the EU outside of the UK and the  citizens of the Channel Islands and Isle of Man a vote. This is grossly unfair and undemocratic. It surely renders the recent referendum morally invalid.

attributes.action: Provide  benefits, housing, and healthcare for returning expats if Brexit occurs
attributes.background: Retired British citizens who have made their homes in Europe fear for their future well-being when they no longer have the right to stay. Returning to Britain, unable to sell the houses they spent their life savings on,requiring  health care, the government should provide now for that eventuality

attributes.action: Please help us stop the closure of Newham Acute Day Hospital.
attributes.background: Newham Acute Day Hospital has helped 1000s of people with mental health problems who are in crisis.  The hospital is a vital, life-saving alternative to inpatient admission.  Let's take a stand against NHS cuts at a time when mental health problems are at epidemic levels in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.newhamrecorder.co.uk/news/health/hospital_bosses_to_consult_on_future_of_newham_mental_health_day_hospital_1_4864973

attributes.action: Full review of sentencing guidelines for convicted child sex offenders
attributes.background:
The legal system would appear to be too lenient on paedophiles. 
Many repeat offenders with dozens of convictions only get suspended prison sentences.  
This is not only no deterrent but also leaves them free to re-offend. 
I would like this reviewed as it is outdated.
attributes.additional_details:
I am aware of a paedophile who was convicted of grooming a 13 year old girl online who he planned to have sex with.
This was his 27th offence and he received an 8 month prison sentence, suspended for 2 years.  I do not feel this is justice for his victim(s).
This is just one of a catalogue of child sex offenders who are getting off too lightly and repeatedly putting vulnerable children in danger.

attributes.action: Stop the disbandment of the British Army White Helmets Motorcycle Display Team.
attributes.background: They are a 30-strong display team from the Royal Corps of Signals and are being scrapped this year. They were Formed in the 1920s and have thrilled millions across the globe for decades with their daredevil displays – but the British Army is Axeing the White Helmets for being ‘out of date’.
attributes.additional_details:
The riders will be given new roles as recruiters by the end of the year, which has saddened many in the military. One White Helmets commander said: ‘It’s a great shame. 'Yet another piece of the Army’s heritage is being scrapped.’

Let's stop this madness - they are not out of date - they are a must for the British Army.!!!

attributes.action: Move Parliament to 6 regional cities while the House of Parliament is repaired.
attributes.background:
The plan for MPs and Lords to vacate the Palace of Westminster during repairs and move to offices nearby is flawed.

MPs should grasp the opportunity to take Parliament to the People.

We call for the UK Parliament to relocate to a different regional city each year of the 6 year refurbishment.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory all authorities scan all domestic pets!
attributes.background: Bodies working in the animal sector, such as vets & shelters, usually scan for a microchip. However this is not compulsory and there are other authorities who will not scan at all such as a number of councils. All authorities working with animals, by law, should be required to scan all domestic pets
attributes.additional_details:
Microchips in domestic pets were introduced so, should an animal be lost or found injured, an owner could be located and notified. 
There is no current legislation which states any authority who comes in to contact with animals has any legal obligation to scan them. 
Dogs and cats can be collected & disposed of by councils without having been scanned and owners will never be informed. This leads to great distress and upset when the owner has a right to be informed of the fate of their companion

attributes.action: A universal label to show if an item contains an animal product.
attributes.background: Seeing how animal agriculture is one of the leaning causes of environmental damage, we need to be better informed. Many products use made up words to hid what's in them. Animal by products are not only used in the end item but also in the making of it. We should be able to clearly see this.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence on Theresa May and Boris Johnson over brexit & Trump visit
attributes.background: It has become clear in our opinion that the government are choosing to ignore the will of the people and continue to go ahead and invite president Trump here in the UK on a state visit, When there is a clear opinion that we the majority of the citizens of the UK do not wish him to visit.
attributes.additional_details: This is proven by the clear mandate in the form of a petition that was posted and now has over one million signatures against the visit. The government are also choosing to ignore the will of the citizens in Ireland and Scotland where there was a clear mandate that people wished to remain in the EU by not allowing them have a separate vote in Brexit. We the citizens therefore have no confidence in Theresa May or Boris Johnson and ask them to resign and call for an early general election.

attributes.action: Oppose the bill to trigger Article 50 in the parliamentary vote.
attributes.background: The ruling that Parliament must vote on whether Brexit is put in motion makes the MPs directly accountable to the people for the most important political decision of a generation. We urge you to listen to the overwhelming expert advice against Brexit and consider what real mandate you have for it.
attributes.additional_details: 73% of 18-24 year olds voted to remain, as did the majority under 45: it is their future you are deciding. The Leave campaign was based on many outright lies, among them promises that we would not leave the single market or the customs union; many Leave voters are showing regret. We remind you of how Labour were made to answer for their decisions on the Iraq war. You, the elected MPs, are the people’s true representatives and the future of the country rests in your hands and on your conscience.

attributes.action: Re-Open hemel hemstead hospital A&E unit.
attributes.background: Since Hemel Hempstead A&E unit closed, Watford A&E unit is struggling to keep up with patients in Hertfordshire.
attributes.additional_details: It became public ,that on our NHS sources, including a statement from Watford general hospital not to attend to A&E unless necessary and Please call 111 first.

attributes.action: Repeal the ECA 1972 BEFORE initiating negotiations under Article 50.
attributes.background: It is critical that this repeal occurs before Article 50 stuff starts, since we can then do so under our own rules, rather than those imposed by the European Union.  If this does not happen, the UK will enter the Article 5 negotiations with one hand tied behind its back.
attributes.additional_details:
European Communities Act 1972

Lisbon Treaty

attributes.action: Stop NHS Trusts investigating their own practice and complaints.
attributes.background: Our sixteen-year-old son Elliot died three years ago following an operation to correct a broken collar bone.  Addenbrookes spent 18 months investigating and reporting on their own practice.  The report was incomplete, inaccurate and a number of discrepancies were highlighted by the Coroner.
attributes.additional_details: In the last three years, we have followed all the procedures and guidelines available to us.  We have complained to the GMC and The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman and we have attempted to take Addenbrookes to court with no success.  Today we were informed that because we have not followed the Addenbrookes complaint procedure to the letter the Ombudsman cannot proceed with their investigation and there is nothing they can do.  It is not right that the NHS Trusts are able to investigate and report on their own practice and when challenged by external organisations set up to protect the patient they are able to delay the process.

attributes.action: Kalydeco (ivacaftor) to be funded for under 6's, by NHS England
attributes.background:
Currently Kalydeco is funded by the NHS for children with a rarer types of Cystic fibrosis from age 6 years and over.
Vertex has recently liscenced the drugs from the age of 2 years. However the NHS has yet to decide whether to agree funding.
This medication is considered life changing
attributes.additional_details:
The treatment is eligible for 9 different rare genotypes and currently funded for ages 2-5, on the NHS in Scotland. At the moment it is only funded in England For those over six years old. Kalydeco has been proven to treat the underlying cause of cystic fibrosis in those 9 gene mutations, to significantly increase lung function, slow the progression of cystic fibrosis and halve hospital admissions.

Please help William and other children effected by cystic fibrosis by signing this petition

attributes.action: Refuges for domestic violence victims MUST be exempt from housing benefit cap.
attributes.background: Refuges for domestic violence victims rely on getting their full rent per room so they can stay open, some local authorities are already refusing funding in the belief that many of these desperately needed refuges may close when the cap is brought in. It is unacceptable that they lose any funding.
attributes.additional_details: As seen on BBC breakfast, these brave women and children will have nowhere else to go. Many don't have a secure location to escape to, and even in refuges can often be tracked down, and in extreme cases even killed. We must insure, not only that they stay open, but be better and more sustainably funded. We need many more refuges, not many less. Thousands of families of abusive partners owe their lives to these refuges, which give them a chance to change identity and live full and secure lives.

attributes.action: Save Savay Farm and Savay lake from HS2
attributes.background: HS2's proposed Colne Viaduct would destroy Savay Lake and the setting of Savay Farm, a grade 1 listed house of immense historical interest which also has a scheduled monument. We want to preserve these precious sites for future generations to enjoy.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 want to build a massive viaduct (2.25 miles long and as tall as a pylon across the Colne Valley in Denham/Harefield. Savay Farm is a grade 1 listed house of great historical significance; nearly 900 years old; former home of Sir Oswald Mosley. Savay Lake is legendary carp-fishing lake and amongst the top 3 fishing lakes in England. Immensely beautiful it is full of wildlife and amazing fish. We want the Secretary of State for Transport to put a tunnel under the Colne Valley to preserve these sites.

attributes.action: Any member of her majesty's armed forces to be the highest priority for housing
attributes.background: Our service personnel are the providers of the freedoms we enjoy. We owe them everything.  It's time we started delivering. We the undersigned demand that upon any form of honourable discharge, all veterans must be placed at the top of the list for social housing, in the area of their choosing.
attributes.additional_details: We have been failing veterans for far too long. Time to put that right.

attributes.action: Introduce regulations to govern static caravan ground rents to stop overcharging
attributes.background: The problem is that static caravan owners have very little rights and need regulations to be put in place to help protect them. A house tenant would have guidelines and a contract but static caravan owners have nothing to protect them and should have a tenancy contract for the ground they rent.
attributes.additional_details: The owners who chose to make that land into plots for static caravans should have to follow similar conditions to being a landlords as effectively thats what they are becoming.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Chinese Lanterns making it a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Chinese Lanterns cause severe burns, severe injury or possibly the loss of Livestock.  
They could potentially cause damage to property starting fires leading to loss of life.
attributes.additional_details:
A young horse received severe burns to his head, face, eyes and around his ears due to a Chinese Lantern landing in his field last night. Luckily his wounds are superficial and the vet has said he will make a full recovery.  He is not the first animal to be injured and won't be the last unless something is done.  

What happens if a lantern lands on a house with a thatched roof? Devastation and loss of human life! Act now. 



https://www.facebook.com/pgeventing/posts/1787032784885609

attributes.action: Stop the Brexit process and declare that Britain will remain in European Union.
attributes.background: In response to the referendum the government is spending a lot of money on preparing to take Britain out of the European Union. This petition calls on the government to immediately stop this process and to declare publicly that Britain will remain in the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was unfair and undemocratic because millions of British citizens living abroad and at least a million citizens of countries in the EU resident of the UK were denied the vote. The great majority of these excluded people are in favour of the UK remaining in the EU and had they been allowed to vote, the result of the referendum would almost certainly have been to remain. I for example am a British citizen resident of Spain but was not allowed to vote so my voice to remain was ignored

attributes.action: Ensure the Pfizer and Flynn Pharma CMA fines are used solely to improve NHS care
attributes.background: Pharmaceutical companies Pfizer and Flynn Pharma have been fined a total of £89.4m by the Competition and Marketing Authority for exploiting a monopoly position over the marketing of the epilepsy drug Epanutin. Their actions have cost the NHS an estimated £44m per year for the last 4 years.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of this scandal has been entirely born by the NHS, and if all the fines are returned to the NHS it will still fall short of the £176m extra the NHS has had to pay for this vital drug. Patients with epilepsy have been most affected, and so some of the money should be used to employ Epilepsy Nurses to improve epilepsy care. See https://binscombedoctorblog.wordpress.com/2012/10/06/the-marketing-of-epanutin-re-energising-a-product-for-an-underserved-population-or-big-pharma-behaving-badly/

attributes.action: Stop the Children and Social Work Bill 2016
attributes.background: The government is trying to pass a bill that includes a section that would allow local councils to apply to be exempt from child protection laws. This is an appalling abuse of power and another attack on the rights of the most vulnerable in our society.
attributes.additional_details: www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0057/17057.pdf

attributes.action: Fund ADHD Clinics with resources for Adult diagnosis assessments across the UK.
attributes.background: ADHD previously known as ADD is not just a problem in children. 50% of adult females & males have it. Funding in the UK for adult diagnosis is beyond disgusting,huge waiting lists. GPs need specialist training. ADHD has 3 different types: inattentive type,hyperactive-impulsive type & combined type.
attributes.additional_details: The disorder is known as a chemical imbalance in the management systems of the brain & experts now believe that this disorder has hereditary, psychological & biological factors.The symptoms in adults can be far less obvious, despite their effect, than those in children. ADHD is very difficult in adult life, and, if left unchecked, sufferers could find themselves with a range of difficulties, like financial complications, problems at work, relationship problems & physical or mental health issues.

attributes.action: To make trespass a criminal offence.
attributes.background: To make trespass a criminal offence, to prevent travellers and others, setting up illegal sites. To prevent the illegal use of private and common land, which also brings with it the problems of illegal waste and unsanitary conditions.

attributes.action: Protect and support the Forest of Dean wildlife especially the wild boar.
attributes.background: The Forest of Dean is unique. It is home to a vast array of wildlife including boar. The health of the wildlife is watched over by  charitable organisations. Because of the nature of the forest it's not unusual for boar to roam in to areas populated by humans. This isn't taken to kindly.
attributes.additional_details: It is our belief that such wild animals will only breed to their environment and if left alone will not over breed. We would like a vast majority of the forest to be a safe zone for our wildlife. And we would like full support for the charities and education to residents in the forest that the flora, fauna and wildlife should be cherished as an I portent part of our heritage.

attributes.action: Start the EU accession process to join the EU in the event of Brexit.
attributes.background:
British government to immediately start the EU accession process to join the EU in the event of Brexit. 

The process to join the EU is long and arduous and will only become more difficult the longer we are out of the EU. We must start the process to join as soon after Brexit as possible.

attributes.action: Call for a general election
attributes.background: Theresa May does not deserve or have the capacity to be the prime minister. She was not voted for by the people and her decisions are detrimental to the whole country, a general election must be held for the country to decide who is best to lead us through these dark times..

attributes.action: Recognise all types of migraines as a serious  disability & not just a headache
attributes.background: Migraine is a serious disability that affects over 6 million people in the U.K.  Most Sufferers go through various symptoms that disables them.   Hemiplegic Migraine is a rare form of migraine that mimics a stroke . In spite of that some people still class Hemiplegic migraine as just a headache.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see links to below outlining the disability 

https://www.migrainetrust.org/about-migraine/types-of-migraine/hemiplegic-migraine/

https://www.facebook.com/MigraineHemiplegic/

attributes.action: Establish a Vetrans OAP hospital using Redford Barracks In Edinburgh
attributes.background: A lot of veteran pensioners within the North of England and the whole of Scotland do not see the Royal Hospital Chelsea as a viable option to retire to due to the distances involved for family and friends to visit and the feelings of isolation that this can cause.
attributes.additional_details: Would it not now be a good time with the announced closures of Redford Barracks in Edinburgh that one of the Barracks was gifted by the MOD for the Use of Veteran OAPs adopting the same lines and procedures as the Royal Hospital Chelsea but opened as a tri service arrangement so that old service personnel can retire to a home that meets not only their medical needs but also their needs of comradeship with the knowing that their families are within a short traveling distance for visiting

attributes.action: Introduce step-free access to all public houses and bars across the UK
attributes.background: As a disabled person who is a wheelchair user, I strive to live my life as closely as I can to that of an able-bodied person. However I often find when wanting to visit pubs and bars that poor access limits the opportunities available to me.
attributes.additional_details:
Throughout my travels I have find that very few pubs and bars as well as establishments generally have good access for disabled people. The vast majority will often have steps that a disabled person cannot overcome without some form of assistance.

Thus the law should be changed meaning that all pubs and bars must have step free access, in a similar manner to them being 'smoke free'. That would greatly improve the opportunities available to disabled people.

attributes.action: The Government should send a declaration of Secession to the EU immediately
attributes.background: Britain does not need a Trade Deal with the EU, in fact, it will be detrimental.  Art. 50 will lead us into years of negotiation with little to show for it on their terms.  A trade deal will keep also keep us tied to the EU.  We need to declare WTO rules and offset tariffs with savings.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will continue to argue for a Brexit on their terms when it should be on ours.  The UK voted to completely leave the EU and by following Art. 50, we shall be tied to them for years.  A simple declaration of secession will leave the EU with the option of treating the UK as any other 3rd State instead of trying to hang on to us.  Savings will offset any tariffs they choose to impose, or they can choose to work with us tariff free to mutual benefit and we can trade with the World immediately

attributes.action: Clarify plans to protect UK Research and Universities from impacts of leaving EU
attributes.background: The prospect of leaving the EU has left the UK's Higher Education and Research sectors - among the country's most successful exporters of services - in damaging uncertainty. Can Government clarify its position on the rights of EU staff, continued research funding, and staff and student recruitment?
attributes.additional_details:
Many staff are EU citizens. Will rights to residence, healthcare, and pensions change?

The UK received €8.8bn EU research  investment 2007-13. Will we still be able to lead/join EU-funded collaborative projects  (Horizon 2020 and beyond) post-Brexit?

Fees for EU students at UK universities are currently the same as for British students. Will these increase?

Will immigration rules affect recruitment of new staff? If so, how?

Answers are needed to address damaging uncertainty in the sector.

attributes.action: Any refugee claiming to be a child to have ID, age and criminal conviction tests
attributes.background:
To safeguard our children, teachers and other school workers (indeed everyone), we are calling for rigorous testing of all refugees claiming to be children. 
Dental checks must be carried out to ascertain age and police checks must be carried out for criminal convictions.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been cases were some refugees claiming to be children have been proved to be adults. This has had alarming consequences from commission of serious assaults to fraud where the refugee has claimed free education from the UK tax payer.
All UK citizens have a HUMAN RIGHT to be protected by our government and this type of testing will go some way to aiding this. 
There is obviously some urgency in the government responding to this and implementing rigorous checks before a tragedy happens.

attributes.action: Stop the privatisation of NHS Professionals
attributes.background: NHS Professionals is the in-house recruitment and staffing agency of the NHS. The government is planning to 'seek external investment' for the organisation - i.e. sell it off to a private, profit making company.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only would this hand a private company a successful NHS agency which makes a profit and has an effective monopoly on staffing, it would also divert crucial funds away from the NHS at a time when it is struggling more than ever with successive budget cuts and increasing pressure on services.

Private companies put profits before patients. The Government must not be allowed to sell off yet another part of our NHS.

attributes.action: Amend the proposed route of HS2, to follow the route of the A42 near to Measham.
attributes.background: The HS2 proposed route has been recently amended. Previously, it followed the existing course of the A42 dual carriageway to the north west of the villiage of Measham. The new proposal takes a route to the south east, passing through housing estates and recreational areas and walkways. Used by many.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hs2-route-to-the-east-midlands-leeds-and-manchester-set-out-by-the-government

attributes.action: Remove the tax on child support for victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
The 4 per cent Child Maintenance Service (CMS) collection fee presents real difficulties, particularly for domestic abuse victims.

For victims, a family-based arrangement is mostly impossible to arrange and using the CMS may be the only safe way for victims of domestic abuse to claim support.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling on the UK Government to protect, not punish victims of domestic violence by removing the 4% collection charge for victim-survivors.

More background information here:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/child-maintenance-service-single-mother-dwp-snp-child-support-agency-a7505746.html

http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/theresa-urged-abolish-cruel-domestic-9446041

http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/news/14961377.Charge_is____cruel____tax_on_abuse_survivors/
